block.p: PHILLIPS-VAN HEUSEN CORP., New York, a maker of apparel and footwear, agreed to license the Arrow brand of dress shirts and sportswear from the Cluett American Corp., also of New York, and acquire Cluett's designer group unit for an undisclosed amount.

LOUDEYE TECHNOLOGIES INC., Seattle, which makes software to broadcast audio and video on the Internet, agreed to buy closely held VidiPax Inc., New York, a provider of media-restoration services. Financial terms were not disclosed.

PHILLIPS-VAN HEUSEN CORP., New York, a maker of apparel and footwear, agreed to license the Arrow brand of dress shirts and sportswear from the Cluett American Corp., also of New York, and acquire Cluett's designer group unit for an undisclosed amount.

LOUDEYE TECHNOLOGIES INC., Seattle, which makes software to broadcast audio and video on the Internet, agreed to buy closely held VidiPax Inc., New York, a provider of media-restoration services. Financial terms were not disclosed.
APPLIED POWER INC., Waukesha, Wis., a maker of industrial and electronic components, sold five warehouses to W. P. Carey & Co., New York, for $29.1 million, and will lease them back.

WESTWOOD ONE INC., New York, which offers local sports, weather and traffic news to about 7,500 radio and television stations, and affiliates of Sandler Capital Management, agreed to buy SmartRoute Systems Inc., Cambridge, Mass., a provider of travel information, for $25 million.
